84802.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bfv3r","text":"N-terminally tagged His6-Z-TEV-LRRK1(FL) was expressed in Sf9 insect cells. Insect cells were infected with baculovirus and grown at 27°C for 3 days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1pcol","text":"Cells were harvested and then resuspended in lysis buffer (50mM HEPES pH 7.4, 500 mM NaCl, 20 mM imidazole, 0.5 mM TCEP, 5% glycerol, 5 mM MgCl2, 20 μM GDP, 0.5 mM Pefabloc and cOmplete EDTA-free protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"189na","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56jfh","text":"Cells were lysed using a Dounce homogenizer and clarified by centrifugation at 50000 rpm, 4°C, 01:28:00, and Ti70 rotor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ek478","text":"The supernatant was incubated for 1 hr with Ni-NTA agarose beads (Qiagen) equilibrated in lysis buffer. Beads were applied to a gravity column where they were extensively washed with lysis buffer,  wash buffer ( 50mM HEPES pH 7.4, 500mM NaCl, 0.5mM TCEP, 5% glycerol, 5mM MgCL2, 20uM GDP), followed by elution in lysis buffer containing 300 mM imidazole ( 50mM HEPES pH 7.4, 500mM NaCl, 0.5mM TCEP, 5% glycerol, 5mM MgCL2, 20uM GDP, 300mM imidazole)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0qf4","text":"The eluted protein was diluted to 250 mM NaCl using dilution buffer (50mM HEPES pH 7.4, 0.5mM TCEP, 5% glycerol, 5mM MgCL2, 20uM GDP) and loaded onto a SP Sepharose column (Cytiva) equilibrated in buffer (50 mM HEPES pH 7.4, 250 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM TCEP, 5% glycerol, 5 mM MgCl2, 20 μM GDP) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75l1t","text":"The protein was eluted using a 250 mM to 2.5 M NaCl gradient. Fractions containing LRRK1(FL) were pooled, diluted to ~500 mM NaCl, and incubated with TEV protease overnight at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"oj6c","text":"The protein was concentrated and put directly over a S200 size exclusion column (Cytiva) equilibrated in storage buffer (50 mM HEPES pH 7.4, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM TCEP, 5% glycerol, 5 mM MgCl2 and 20 μM GDP).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b08hv","text":"The protein was concentrated to ~5-6 μM and flash frozen in liquid nitrogen for storage. N-terminally tagged His6-Z-TEV-LRRK120-2015 was purified using the same protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"418ec","text":"Protocol used to prepare LRRK2-RCKW: DARPin:MLi-2 complex and cryo-EM grid preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4e56o","text":"His6-Z-TEV-LRRK2-RCKW was expressed and purified as described in a previous protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"673jd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"406aa","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4spne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qf1p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":84802,"title":"LRRK1 expression and purification","title_html":"LRRK1 expression and purification","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"lrrk1-expression-and-purification-cw3axgie","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Robert Fagiewicz","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"n4qle132u1y4vle1","link":null,"image":{"source":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/AFdZucpAG0wdQW60klnYvAjXuFZGG_71zq8-M-wmIVmIbQ=s96-c","placeholder":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/AFdZucpAG0wdQW60klnYvAjXuFZGG_71zq8-M-wmIVmIbQ=s96-c","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":8},"type_id":1,"guid":"78DE81301F6511EE9E9CF59C42CF2F5A"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9d3hk","text":"E11 DARPin purified as described in the next protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pjje","text":"We used UltraAuFoil Holey Gold 2/2 200 mesh grids and plasma cleaning them in the Solarus II (Gatan) using the QuantiFoil Au preset.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8k2ae","text":"Prepare LRRK2 buffer exchange. Keep it at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15mgc","text":"20 millimolar (mM) HEPES pH=7.4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"s3gb","text":"150 millimolar (mM) NaCl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ak0j8","text":"2.5 millimolar (mM) MgCl2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t73k","text":"20 micromolar (µM) GDP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"773rf","text":"0.5 millimolar (mM) TCEP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"lme1","text":"Spin down purified LRRK2-RCKW (10000 rcf, 4°C, 10 minutes). Leave protein on ice afterward.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftnof","text":"For the best result, keep protein on ice and reduce the amount of time between spinning\nand freezing cryo-EM samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4n3jg","text":"Exchange buffer using a spin desalting column (Zeba‱ Spin Desalting Columns, 7K MWCO (Catalog number: 89877). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D665B9D44C3011EE83BB0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2n8v","text":"Spin down again the exchange buffer LRRK2-RCKW (10000 rcf, 4°C, 10 minutes) and measure the concentration. Leave protein on ice afterward","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13fpt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e6h3m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e7a7t","text":"The initial concentration range was 20-40 uM. The final concentration might be half of the initial one. Final volume might be 13-16 uL.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hj9g","text":"Based on LRRK2-RCKW concentration, add the necessary volume to get a proportional ratio\nLRRK2:DARPin:MLi-2 1:1.25:3 and dilute to a final 10 micromolar (µM) LRRK2-RCKW concentration using exchange buffer (150 mM NaCl).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b0275","text":"Thaw E11 DARPin and spin it down. Measure its concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b6eur","text":"Incubate 10 minutes at RT. Afterward, keep it on ice until grid preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ini","text":"Dilute MLi-2 stock (diluted in 100% DMSO) to a desired concentration ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnrkt","text":"Dilute the sample to the desired concentration using the LRRK2 exchange buffer. We used 6 micromolar (µM).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ooro","text":"Apply 3 to 3.5 microliters (µl) of sample and plunge freeze. We used a
Vitrobot (FEI) to blot away excess sample and plunge freeze in ethane liquid. (In
our case, we use 4 seconds as a time blot as 20 sec as a wait time and 4 as a blot force, but these
parameters are slightly different from one Vitrobot to another. I would try
with the Vitrobot parameters already tested in your machine first).
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"47j0k","text":"Store grids in liquid nitrogen until ready for imaging","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: LRRK2-RCKW: MLi-2: E11 DARPin cryo-EM sample preparation
title_html: LRRK2-RCKW: MLi-2: E11 DARPin cryo-EM sample preparation
